For a 12th-grade Calculus lesson focused on the topic of Derivation, here are some recommended resources and activities:

Resources:
1. Textbook: Utilize the calculus chapter in your current textbook, such as "Calculus: Early Transcendentals" by James Stewart.
2. Online articles: Encourage students to read articles that explain the concept of derivation in a real-world context. Students can search for "real-life applications of derivation" on Google to find relevant articles.
3. Khan Academy: Recommend the Derivatives section of Khan Academy, where students can watch videos and work on practice problems to reinforce their understanding. (Go to Khan Academy and type "derivative calculus" in the search bar)

Activities:
1. Interactive simulations: Have students explore online simulations that allow them to visually understand the concept of derivation. They can search for interactive calculus simulations on Google and choose a reliable one to complete.
2. Problem-solving exercises: Provide students with a set of derivative problems to solve independently or in groups. You can search for "derivative calculus problems" on Google to find a variety of exercises and examples.
3. In-class demonstrations: Conduct hands-on demonstrations to illustrate the concept of derivation. For example, you can use real-life graphs and objects to explain how the derivative represents the slope of a function.

Remember to align the activities with your specific learning objectives and instructional style. I hope these suggestions help you plan an engaging and effective Derivation lesson for your 12th-grade Calculus class!
